subject: Communication
title: Reframing: Changing the Lens
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Reframing: Changing the Lens.

hook.text: 'He's lazy and doesn't care.' Reframed: 'He seems overwhelmed. What support does he need?' Same person. Different story.

buildup.text: Reframing transforms conflict by changing how the situation is described ‚Äî without changing the facts.

discovery.text: Mediators reframe accusations into needs: 'She never listens' becomes 'You need to feel heard.

twist.text: Reframing isn't spinning or minimizing. It's finding the legitimate need hiding behind the hostile expression.

climax.text: Once a conflict is reframed from 'us vs. them' to 'us vs. the problem,' collaborative solutions emerge naturally.

punchline.text: Change the frame and the entire conflict changes with it.

quiz.question: What is the goal of reframing in mediation?
